medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Sharp pain in the upper abdomen began at about noon the day prior to admission. The pain radiates across the anterior abdomen but not to the back, is intermittent, and lasts less than an hour each episode. The patient experienced 2 episodes of non-bloody emesis at home. By the morning of admission, she reports feeling very good with only slight abdominal pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, aortic stenosis, pernicious anemia, warm autoimmune hemolytic anemia, vitamin B12 deficiency anemia, history of left patellar fracture, history of chronic left greater than right lower extremity swelling.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of gallstones, premature CAD, sudden death, or autoimmune hemolytic anemia.
